def isnamedtupleinstance(x):
    _type = type(x)
    bases = _type.__bases__
    if len(bases) != 1 or bases[0] != tuple:
        return False
    fields = getattr(_type, '_fields', None)
    if not isinstance(fields, tuple):
        return False
    return all(type(i)==str for i in fields)

def unpack(obj):
    if isinstance(obj, dict):
        return {key: unpack(value) for key, value in obj.items()}
    elif isinstance(obj, list):
        return [unpack(value) for value in obj]
    elif isnamedtupleinstance(obj):
        return {key: unpack(value) for key, value in obj._asdict().items()}
    elif isinstance(obj, tuple):
        return tuple(unpack(value) for value in obj)
    else:
        return obj

write_json[source]

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class AttrDict[source]

AttrDict(value=None) :: dict

dict() -> new empty dictionary dict(mapping) -> new dictionary initialized from a mapping object's (key, value) pairs dict(iterable) -> new dictionary initialized as if via: d = {} for k, v in iterable: d[k] = v dict(**kwargs) -> new dictionary initialized with the name=value pairs in the keyword argument list. For example: dict(one=1, two=2)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

pretty_json[source]

pretty_json(i, fpath=None, indent=4)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
x = {'a': {'b': 10, 'c': 11}, 'd': {'e': {'f': [2, 3, 2.234]}}}

y = AttrDict(x)

assert y.a.b == 10
assert y.d.e.f == [2,3,2.234]

y.d.e.g = 11

assert y.to_dict() == {'a': {'b': 10, 'c': 11}, 'd': {'e': {'f': [2, 3, 2.234], 'g': 11}}}

y.pretty()

{
    "a": {
        "b": 10,
        "c": 11
    },
    "d": {
        "e": {
            "f": [
                2,
                3,
                2.234
            ],
            "g": 11
        }
    }
}

from torch_snippets.paths import *
from torch_snippets.logger import *

d = [1,{1:1,2:2},3]

pretty_json({1:1,2:2})
pretty_json(d)

f = write_json(d, '/tmp/test.json')
print(f)
read_json(f)
